author: Becky Lyne
comment: Really good for working collaboratively on projects. For more  personal use it would be great if you could move the cards on the page that collates all your cards from different boards into an order you plan to do them (without faffing about with putting a due date on them that is liable to change). Even better would be if you could move the cards around in a quadrant: bottom left = easy, not important, top left = easy, important, top right = difficult, important, bottom right normally = difficult, not important, but I list my personal to-dos in here eg buy birthday pressie, wash car, book hair etc! Hope you might consider this functionality - would make my life complete! 😉 But great work so far! 😊. Thanks!

author: Andrew Turincio
comment: It's a good app! The bug invloving picture orinetation on v30 has been fixed in latest update. The support team took initiative and worked with me to get the bug sent to the tech team. Very impressed!

reply.author: Trello, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Andrew! We'd love to take a closer look at that. Would you mind sending us an example at trello.com/contact?

comment: When replying to someone's comment, I would like to see it as you would in Facebook (tiered comments). This would make it easier to know which comments relate to which. As of now, there is no structure to them and it can be confusing especially if you all looking at a card that is not current.

author: Leon Kr
comment: The best cross-platform way of planning together and sharing progress. Every now and then it would be nice to have a few features like swimlanes for subtasks etc but that could just be that I'm way to demanding from my background in software engineering

author: Tomáš Jozífek
comment: Why do i have to add myself to members to see a card in the widget each time i create a card? It's a bit complicated but boy is it feature rich.
Trello is awesome for making lists and categorizing them, but there's no way to alphabetize items in a list. Please add an option to do this!

author: Felipe Neris
comment: Interface limpa e intuitiva. Super funcional! Tem tudo que um aplicativo de gerência de projetos simples precisa ter na sua versão gratuita!

author: Store Center
comment: Trello is mostly a to-do app with comment feature. I can't send message to any team member, there's no file manager.

author: Affan Thakur
comment: Use it all day long to manage personal and business works. Can't imagine working without it now.

author: Guillaume L'Her
comment: Fantastic tool. Great for a team probably, but I use it just to organize my various tasks and projects, and it is excellent.

author: Adityarup Laha
comment: I use it as a storage, to-do list & notepad. It does what it's supposed to do. Keep up the good work.

author: Jimmy Texas
comment: Needs to allow adding due dates to cards and adding various colors and categories to specific cards

author: Vangelis Tsiatsianas
comment: Other than the features and great overall app, the release notes are always one of a kind! 😃

author: Jesús Moyano
comment: It's perfect to organize and doesn't lose any important task

author: Валентин Морозов
comment: I use it both for personal and business tasks. It has many powerups for different purposes

author: Anna-Marie B
comment: Needs better widgets... very limited functionality - could be really improved

author: Fadil Nohur
comment: Like a personal version of Jira!

author: H Wh
comment: Glorified to do list.

author: Francois Wolfaardt
comment: Great app Very easy to use Love the labels Very handy with marketing

author: Roger Monteiro
comment: Using for university.

author: Zhir Jalal
comment: Keep up the amazing experience! thank you

author: Rémi GONTIER
comment: Damn, the best tool ever.

author: Sridhar Pandurangaiah
comment: Awesome tool to organise your tasks.

author: Marius Kavoliūnas
comment: Beauty in simplicity. Nice app

author: Farhad Ghasemi
comment: Many thanks to the Trello teams

author: Kris spoops
comment: I love ot

author: Pedro Lobo
comment: Amazing!

author: Mouteih Chaghlil
comment: Love the simplicity

author: Pandu Rijal Pasa
comment: Lovely

author: dd jj
comment: Good

author: Dilip Nair
comment: Good app. Good ideology. It's evident that lots of thought and efforts have gone into this app. I use it daily and will recommend it to others as well to be more productive and make sure  the important tasks are not missed out. Few suggestions I would like to make though to the developers:  1. It would be awesome to have a search option inside a card in the Android app to search for words  2. The reminder could be more effective by letting users set reminders separately for every individual item on a card.

author: Matt Park
comment: Tello is growing on me everyday. I especially like the cross platform compatibility across tablets, phones, and desktops. It is just the right amount of rigor, flexibility, and fun to use to keep me using it.  While checking out the recent Trello app for my other operating system phone, there was a funny plea for reviews (I think it was meant to be funny) that hooked me.

author: Spike Buxton
comment: This app is one of the most crucial things to my company and helps me communicate easier with employees among four different stores and nine different employees. It helps us to make sure we keep inventory accurate and don't run out of things and keep up on what needs to be fixed in each store and helps us make the schedule for when employees need to come into work. Don't know what we would do without it.

author: Devendra Lad
comment: Simple yet so powerful. I was using wunderlist. Came to know that wunderlist was shutting down. Was trying to find better app. First I installed this on Macbook. Easy simple powerful with powerups. Guys don't sell your company like wunderlist. You have done very good job. If I go build up my business I will totally use Trello to track my business.

author: jim hayward
comment: I love the idea but the reminder implementation is a deal breaker for me. The notification always fires 24hrs before it's due. I'm a fan for putting a reminder on something for when I want to be reminded. If I want one 24hrs early or more than I'd set an extra reminder or two. So for me it's not good. Love the general design otherwise.

Just great for handling my todo lists and organising group tasks in my business. I use the PC version mostly and the app for when I'm out and about. Since I've been using it I'm 5 times more organised. Great drag and drop action to organise lists and attach documents. I've seen far worse apps and programs charging exorbitant monthly subscriptions. Brilliant app just try it!

author: Jakob K.
comment: I like the app itself, but it desperately needs a widget displaying and possibly editing some list for some board without myself being assigned to the cards. It seems like you mainly consider people using Trello in a team, but loads of people use it to organise their daily lives as well.

author: Christine Buice
comment: Trello's capabilities allow organising to better reflect real life in all its rich chaos.  It accounts for the fact that life is multifaceted with overlapping domains. The tool doesn't try to force life into  neat little separate boxes and static lists. But the interface allows you to organize your thoughts and focus so you aren't overwhelmed. The developers are working from reality instead of an oversimplification of life.

author: Rafael Vila
comment: Love the app, available in all platforms. 4 stars because the experience becomes annoying with a large team scrolling horizontally even in phones, should have option to change preferred orientation per device.

I do not write reviews for many products, but I can tell you that Trello is one of the best apps I have ever used. My wife and I consistently use it to keep track of everything from groceries to potential baby names. Incredibly useful an accessible.
